official-title.#text:
Providing for the consideration of the bill (S. 815) to prohibit employment discrimination on the
			 basis of sexual orientation or gender identity.

sponsor.#tail: submitted the following resolution; which was referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall proceed to the consideration in
			 the House of the bill (

shall be considered as adopted. The bill, as amended, shall be
			 considered as read. All points of order against provisions in the bill, as
			 amended, are waived. The previous question shall be considered as ordered
			 on the bill, as amended, and on any further amendment thereto, to final
			 passage without intervening motion except one hour of debate equally
			 divided and controlled by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
ranking minority member of the
			 Committee on Education and the Workforce

text.#text: That immediately upon adoption of this resolution, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
of the bill
			 and insert the following:

text.#text: The amendment described in this section is an amendment to

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
), applicable to a religious corporation,
			 association, educational institution, or society with respect to the
			 employment of individuals of a particular religion to perform work
			 connected with the carrying on by such corporation, association,
			 educational institution, or society of its activities. Such organizations
			 are not exempt from the requirements of this Act to refrain from
			 discrimination based on sexual orientation or gender identity, in the same
			 manner as is required with respect to discrimination based on race, color,
			 sex and national origin under such title.

text.#text: This Act shall not change the requirements of

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: title VII of the Civil Rights Act of 1964

text.#text: Clause 1(c) of rule XIX shall not apply to the consideration of
